body.p:
Louisville: Ky. Jany 21" 1864
Thomas E. Bramlette; --
Gov. of Ky.

We, the undersigned citizens of Louisville, have heard of the conviction of Henry Byerback, of the charge of "malicious stabbing with intent to Kill," & are satisfied that it would be but an act of justice and clemency on the part of your Excellency to pardon him, and give him his liberty. He is the only son of aged parents; his father is almost blind, & his mother, burdened with many years. He is only twenty three years of age- and had, through his short career, been an industrious, quiet, hardworking, law abiding youth, and will, it is believed, if pardoned, be an honest, loyal citizen. He served in the armies of his country, until called home by domestic duties he could not disregard. It is therefore our earnest request that he be pardoned & saved from the disgrace of confinement in the penitentiary-

Wm Wix
Jeff Brown.
R H Rouseau
Jack Fry
A. M. Gazlay
Thos W. Gibson
Jas. A. Beattie.
Robt J. Elliott
F. Maguire
T. Jack Conn.
James Harrison
George W Caruth.
Wm L Barret
Jno. W. Barr
C. P. Rudd
W. A. Harner
Saml Russell,
Tho. W. Riley
Jno G. Simerall
G. P. Arbegust
R. Knott
J H Harney
R. H. Cockrell
R. F. Baird
J. H. Price
Nat Wolfe
I have no personal knowledge of this case but from the Statements of Alford T. Pope Esq. in which I have full confidence I join most cheerfully in the prayer for the pardon. Jany 21.

Isaac Caldwell
Paul R. Shipman
Geo. P. Doson
S. S. Bush
Hamilton Pope
Alfred J. Pope
H. C. Shivell
Isaac D Stone
W. F. Bullock
Phil Tomppert Jr
Robert Risse

The above petition is erroneous in one particular viz;- they, the parents, have one other son, who, though, is deaf & almost blind_ The error was stated to those whose signatures are to be seen above.

Alfred J. Pope
Atty. for deft.

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Wm Byerback
Prayer for pardon granted. Issue pardon to Wm Byerback the name being improperly stated on petition.

Malicious Stabbing
Jany term 1864
Pardoned
22nd Jany 1864
